intro: Pentaraphia montana, commonly known as the mountain pentaphylloides, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
